eu.focusnet.app.ui.activity

Class ToolbarEnabledActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Activity
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        • android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
          • eu.focusnet.app.ui.activity.ToolbarEnabledActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PageActivity, ProjectActivity, ProjectsListingActivity

    public abstract class ToolbarEnabledActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
    The ToolbarEnabledActivity is used as the basis for Activities that have a title bar and a content below.

    • Field Detail

      • toolbar

        protected android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar toolbar
        The toolbar, i.e. the top bar with title and action buttons

      • actionBar

        protected android.support.v7.app.ActionBar actionBar
        The ActionBar of this activity. We operate in compatibility activity, so we set a Toolbar and must perform actions such as setting titles on the corresponding ActionBar.

        Currently active fragment

        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Inherited.

      • setupSpecificUiElements

        protected void setupSpecificUiElements()
        Method that may be overriden to setup Activity-specific UI elements, such as a Drawer or Action buttons. This method is only called once, in onCreate(Bundle).

      • applyUiChanges

        protected final void applyUiChanges()
        Load the UI, based on the current Activity configuration as defined by onCreate(Bundle), including via setupSpecificUiElements().

        This method is called from onCreate(Bundle) and whenever the UI must be refreshed.

      • getTargetView

        protected abstract int getTargetView()
        Retrieve the content of the view

      • doInPageUiOperations

        protected void doInPageUiOperations()
        Do any UI operation that do not imply creating and including a new Fragment in the UI, such as displaying an AlertDialog.

        See applyUiChanges().

      • prepareNewFragment

        protected void prepareNewFragment()
        Prepare a new Fragment before its inclusion in the UI.

        See applyUiChanges().
